Headline: #156 LaSalle Temporary Southbound Reroute near Belmont/Hudson
ShortDescription: SB 156 LaSalle buses are temporarily rerouted via Belmont, Halsted, Addison, Inner Lake Shore Drive and Sheridan: due to, street blockage near Belmont/Hudson.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Southbound 1#56 LaSalle buses are temporarily rerouted via Belmont, Halsted, Addison, Inner Lake Shore Drive and Sheridan: due to, street blockage near Belmont/Hudson.

Northbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: #77 Belmont Temporary Reroute near Belmont/Hudson
ShortDescription: 77 Belmont rrtd EB via Blmnt, Hlstd, Addison, In. Lk Shore Dr & Sheridan: WB via Blmnt, In. Lk Shore Dr, Addison, Hlstd & Blmnt due to blockage nr Blmnt/Hudson

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?

#77 Belmont buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions due to street blockage near Belmont/Hudson.

  • Eastbound buses will operate via Belmont, Halsted, Addison, Inner Lake Shore Drive and Sheridan
  • Westbound buses will operate via Belmont, Inner Lake Shore Drive, Addison, Halsted and Belmont.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Service Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, then Racine (Blue Line) Stations, Only
ShortDescription: Pink Line trains operate from 54th to Polk only, then connect w/Blue Line at Racine for continuing service due to signal problems near Adams/Wabash.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Pink Line service has been temporarily suspended between Polk and the Loop due to signal problems near Adams/Wabash.

As a result, Pink Line trains are running as follows:

  • Between 54th/Cermak and Polk, and then are diverted to Racine on the Blue Line for direct connections at Racine to continuing Blue Line train service to/from downtown.

Using connecting Blue Line service:

  • For service to downtown from Pink Line stations between 54th/Cermak and Polk, take a Pink Line train toward the Loop and stay on board until the train reaches Racine on the Blue Line. Transfer to an O'Hare-bound Blue Line train from the same platform for service into downtown.

  • For service from downtown to Pink Line stations between Polk and 54th/Cermak, take a Blue Line train toward Forest Park to Racine. Stay on the same platform side and wait for a 54th/Cermak-bound Pink Line train.

Other possible alternatives may include: 

  • #9 Ashland
  • #21 Cermak
  • #49 Western
  • #50 Damen
  • #52 Kedzie/California
  • #53 Pulaski
  • #54 Cicero
  • #60 Blue Island-26th
  • #82 Kimball-Homan
  • #94 South California
  • #157 Streeterville-Taylor buses

...including to/from and in combination with other 'L' services.

Note that if you take a bus to/from the Pink Line, you may also be able to connect to/from the Blue Line's Forest Park branch or Green Line along Lake Street directly via that bus route.

See station personnel for further assistance, and pay attention to announcements on trains and at stations for service information.

We are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Major Delays, Limited Service on Loop 'L'
ShortDescription: Major delays/limited service capacity on the Loop 'L' due to signal problems at Adams/Wabash.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Major delays/limited service capacity on the Loop 'L' due to signal problems at Adams/Wabash.

As a result of the delay, shuttle buses have been requested to provide connecting service. Shuttle bus service is as follows:

  • Brown Line shuttle buses will be available from Fullerton to Clark/Lake
  • Green Line shuttle buses are available from Cermak-McCormick Place to State/Lake
  • Orange Line shuttle buses are available from Halsted to Clark/Lake
  • Pink Line shuttle buses are available from Clinton to Clark/Lake.

Note: Trains and platforms may be busier than usual and become crowded at times. For your safety, please stand clear of the platform edge.

We appreciate your patience as we work to restore service. Allow extra travel time.
